Carmen Salazar Portfolio

Welcome to my data analyst portfolio! After many dedicated years in academia and delving into the depths of sociological research, i made the decision to transition my career to the dynamic field of data analytics. My transition from academia to this vibrant field is driven by a deep desire to make meaningful contributions, leverage data-driven insights, and address real-world challenges faced by organizations. In this portfolio, i invite you on a journey through my data adventures. I explore the power of analytics where numbers come alive and guide the way forward.@SCarmenGithub

Data Cleaning in SQL

This project involves using SQL Server to enhance the usability of raw housing data for analysis purposes. Through data cleaning techniques, we optimize the data for meaningful insights.


View Project on GitHub

Data Exploration in Python

Data exploration of neighborhood investment and disinvestment in Python. I explore economic and racial characteristics of distinct Washington D.C spatial areas and their association with levels of reinvestment within them.


View Project on GitHub

Survival Insights: Class, Age, Gender, and Embarkment

This visualization presents a comprehensive overview of the survivors of the Titanic shipwreck. It examines the survival rates based on various variables, including passenger Socioeconomic Status (1 = Upper, 2 = Middle, 3 = Lower), age groups, gender, and the port of embarkation.

View Project on Tableau

Terrorism Across Time and Borders

In this Tableau project, I visually explore data on terrorism attacks, highlighting the most active and prominent organizations and groups involved in these attacks, categorized by regions.


View Project on Tableau

Oh, H., Golash-Boza, T., Rajabally, W., & Salazar, C. (2023). Marginal Gentrification and Racial Capitalism in a Post-chocolate City. Sociological Perspectives, 0(0). https://doi.org/10.1177/07311214231177007
